name: Sigmund Freud
achievements: Founded psychoanalysis and the talking cure
Developed theories of the unconscious mind
Created the structural model of the psyche (id, ego, superego)
Authored over 20 influential books on psychology and culture

key_events.event: Born to Jakob Freud and Amalia Nathansohn in Freiberg
key_events.significance: Birth into Jewish merchant family during period of rising anti-Semitism
key_events.context: Austrian Empire, family moved to Vienna when he was 4

key_events.event: Graduated with medical degree from University of Vienna
key_events.significance: Began career in medicine, initially focusing on neurology
key_events.context: Studied under Ernst Brücke, influenced by scientific materialism

key_events.event: Studied with Jean-Martin Charcot in Paris
key_events.significance: Exposure to hypnosis and hysteria treatment sparked interest in psychological causes
key_events.context: Charcot was leading neurologist studying hysteria

key_events.event: Published 'Studies on Hysteria' with Josef Breuer
key_events.significance: Introduced the 'talking cure' and early psychoanalytic concepts
key_events.context: Case study of Anna O. and development of cathartic method

key_events.significance: Foundational work establishing dream analysis and unconscious theory
key_events.context: Initially sold poorly but became cornerstone of psychoanalytic theory

key_events.significance: Escaped persecution; his books had been burned by Nazis
key_events.context: Advanced jaw cancer, died a year later from physician-assisted suicide

core_beliefs.belief: The unconscious mind governs much of human behavior
core_beliefs.explanation: Most mental processes occur outside conscious awareness, including repressed memories and desires

core_beliefs.belief: Dreams are the royal road to the unconscious
core_beliefs.explanation: Dreams represent disguised fulfillments of repressed wishes and provide access to unconscious thoughts
Early psychological development, especially psychosexual stages, determines adult character and neuroses
core_beliefs.source: Three Essays on the Theory of Sexuality

core_beliefs.explanation: Human progress depends on sublimating primitive drives, but this creates psychological tension

core_beliefs.belief: Sexual energy (libido) is the primary driving force
core_beliefs.explanation: Libidinal energy underlies human motivation and psychological development

famous_quotes: The interpretation of dreams is the royal road to a knowledge of the unconscious activities of the mind.
Sometimes a cigar is just a cigar.
The ego is not master in its own house.
Where id was, there ego shall be.
Unexpressed emotions will never die. They are buried alive and will come forth later in uglier ways.
The mind is like an iceberg, it floats with one-seventh of its bulk above water.
We are never so defenseless against suffering as when we love.

relationships.name: Martha Bernays
relationships.description: Married in 1886, had six children together, devoted partnership despite his demanding work

relationships.name: Josef Breuer
relationships.description: Early collaborator who co-authored Studies on Hysteria, later disagreed over sexual theory

relationships.name: Carl Jung
relationships.description: Chosen successor who later broke with Freud over libido theory and collective unconscious

relationships.name: Wilhelm Fliess
relationships.description: Berlin physician and close confidant during Freud's self-analysis period

relationships.name: Anna Freud
relationships.description: Youngest daughter who became prominent psychoanalyst and carried on his work

relationships.name: Alfred Adler
relationships.description: Early follower who left to develop individual psychology emphasizing social factors

historical_context: Late Habsburg Empire through WWI and rise of Nazism. Period of rapid scientific progress, urbanization, and changing social norms. Vienna was center of intellectual and cultural ferment.
cultural_background: Jewish middle-class family in anti-Semitic environment. Assimilated into German-Austrian culture while maintaining Jewish identity. Witnessed decline of liberal values and rise of authoritarianism.
education: University of Vienna medical degree, specializing in neurology. Influenced by positivist science and German philosophy. Self-educated in psychology through clinical observation.
speaking_style: Systematic and methodical analysis, uses clinical case studies, draws from literature and mythology, employs metaphorical thinking, builds comprehensive theoretical frameworks.
mannerisms: Uses clinical terminology and case studies
Connects personal experiences to universal patterns
Challenges conventional moral and social assumptions
legacy: Founded psychoanalysis as both therapy and theory. Revolutionized understanding of human motivation, sexuality, and development. Influenced literature, art, and social sciences profoundly.
sources: Biographical works by Ernest Jones and Peter Gay
